attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Wether or not the component is actually disabled.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description: Optional, if provided, the button contains an a11y-anchor inside.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: What state the button has.

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: If "to" is provided, should the link have a target be set?

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: What kind of default-provided theme shall be applied.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: What kind of button this one is.

description.value:
Collects buttons. Horizontally. Supports `--gap`.
If `autohide` is true, any items which to not fit will be
rendered as <msc-item /> within an Menu.

attributes.name: autohide
attributes.description:
Hide's the last X items that don't fit to the parent container.
items will be re-rendered as <msc-item />

attributes.name: to
attributes.description: Link where to go to when click

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
if an href (usually called "to" as attribute/prop) is provided,
should there be a specific target type applied?

description.value: TODO: Allow Animations; set duration via css-var

attributes.name: align-x
attributes.description:
Overwrites the placement of content (NOT items!) on the horizontal axis
See flexbox values
May swap with horizontal alignment for correct behaviour

attributes.name: align-y
attributes.description:
Overwrite placement of content (NOT items!) on the vertical axis
See flexbox values
May swap with horizontal alignment for correct behaviour

attributes.name: center
attributes.description: Centers the content of this container (NOT items!) on both axis.

attributes.name: content-scroll
attributes.description: Enables purposefully scrolling for the content of this tag.

attributes.name: track-x
attributes.description:
Changes the placement direction of this container.
See flexbox specs. Applies "weird behaviour" fixes of flexbox.

attributes.name: track-y
attributes.description:
Changes the placement direction of this container.
See flexbox specs. Applies "weird behaviour" fixes of flexbox.

description.value: Utilizes DataProvider Service to define the children asap the component can be initialized.

attributes.name: base
attributes.description: The minimum width of an item of the grid

attributes.name: center-content
attributes.description: Center container of all item-containers?

attributes.name: center-items
attributes.description: Center grid items in their item-container?

attributes.name: gap
attributes.description: The minimum width of an item of the grid

attributes.name: center-items
attributes.description: Should every cell's height equal to it's --base width?

attributes.name: template
attributes.description: Define's the grid-template

description.value: TODO: This class is still buggy for subsequent updates.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The iconName to resolve. This is dependant on how you declared your own
IconSet.

attributes.name: set
attributes.description:
The IconSet to pick the icon-name from.
If not provied, the `defaultIconSet` is used from ApplicationService.

attributes.name: autocomplete
attributes.description:
Should this input field autocomplete?
Ignored for type="radio" and type="checkbox"

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Is your input disabled?

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Under what name should the value be stored inside the form?

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description: The value to display when there is no value.

attributes.name: required
attributes.description: Is your input required?

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The type of input you need.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: The value the component has/holds.

attributes.name: to
attributes.description:
An attribute/prop that is usually exposed as "to" which intern will
open the provided link when activated.
Or whatever the criteria is.
!IMPORTANT! To make your life easier, be sure to set the prop to "reflect" the current value!

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
if an href (usually called "to" as attribute/prop) is provided,
should there be a specific target type applied?

description.value:
If you provide custom actions and those need to onAffirm or onReject, don't
forget to add data-positive or data-negative!

attributes.name: closing-x
attributes.description: Show's an closing-X at the top right.

attributes.name: message
attributes.description:
The important message you need to devliever to your user.
If an array is supplied, each item will be wrapped in an paragraph.

attributes.name: text-negative
attributes.description:
If provided, this value is used to render the default, negative button.
Only needed to overwrite the text, you can also overwrite the whole button
if you define "data-negative" as attribute inside your slot named action.

attributes.name: text-positive
attributes.description:
If provided, this value is used to render the default, positive button.
Only needed to overwrite the text, you can also overwrite the whole button
if you define "data-positive" as attribute inside your slot named action.

attributes.name: title
attributes.description: The title to display at the top. Supply a falsy value to disclose.

attributes.name: global
attributes.description:
Don't position using "absolute".
Ignore parent, use position "fixed" when true.

attributes.name: is-visible
attributes.description:
*** DO NOT SET THIS VALUE BY HAND; THIS IS READONLY/INITIAL ASSIGNMENT ***
If you're using a framework, you can set it. Otherwise, no.
Call myModal.toggle() in html. Designed for JSX assignment.

attributes.name: omit
attributes.description:
Not only can you overwrite the texts and buttons that are present by default,
using this prop you are also be able to exclude certain actions.
E.g. Dialogs.alert() will omit the negative action.

attributes.name: role
attributes.description: Defines the Modal-Role. Is it a dismissable alert or dialog?

attributes.name: auto-show
attributes.description: Should the Sidebar expand when you're near it?

attributes.name: fixed
attributes.description: If true, styling applies position: fixed instead of position: absolute

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Should the Sidebar always be open?

attributes.name: overlay
attributes.description:
Wether or not the sidebar should take up space in the document.
If true, full content is exposed on hovering/tap.

attributes.name: side
attributes.description: If true, styling applies position: fixed instead of position: absolute

attributes.name: single
attributes.description: Controls wether or not only one item can be expanded.

attributes.name: dismissable
attributes.description: If true, toast will be gone when clicked.

attributes.name: indicator
attributes.description:
If true, only the most important things are rendered to make the toast work.
Pure extendabillity for your!

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: The message to show in the Toast.

attributes.name: message-title
attributes.description: A small string that's rendered <**bold** />

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Visual state how the tosat looks

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: How long the toast shall be visible. Use a falsy value for no timeout.

description.value:
The "tooltip" is an essential component that helps you to define a more descriptive message for another element.

It also helps you to describe icons and any other component(s) that aren't descriptive enough by default for disabled users.

ATTENTION: This component will always add itself as last element to the viewport.
This is to ensure that the tooltip is always visible in any case, additionally, it ensures that nested - scrollable views, do not conflict in the global viewport offset.

Just keep in mind that you declare the component context-based, but the component itself is rendered globally, while maintaining it's created context.

You can also overwrite the target-context by providing a "for" selector.

attributes.name: for
attributes.description:
Idenficator (id) for targeted element. Fallback to <slot/> if not provided.
Tooltip will be placed relative to the found element.
If the element is not found, the component will break (but a developer notice will be logged).

attributes.name: global
attributes.description:
All tooltips are now globally positioned by default.
It's just better.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: What should the displayed within the tooltip?

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
Where the actual tooltip needs to be positioned.
Ignored when there is no space.
